title: Generate sensitive data for OO Containerized
content:
The outcome of this step is the creation of a Kubernetes secret named oo-secret, that holds the required sensitive data OO needs to be installed: the passwords of the database users created during the preparation steps and the suite IDM integration passwords. 

The name of this Kubernetes secret is by default referenced in the OO values.yaml file (at the Helm parameter global.initSecrets), and at the time of OO installation, its data is automatically consumed by the deployed OO pods.

Use the gen_secrets.sh tool from OMT to prepare the sensitive data.

  1. Run the following command on the control plane node:

    $CDF_HOME/scripts/gen_secrets.sh -n <OO namespace> -c <OO chart file>
    Where:
    <OO namespace> is the unique namespace of the OO deployment. Use the namespace you specified in the Create a new deployment for OO page.
    <OO chart file> is the absolute path of the OO chart file.
    For example: 
    $CDF_HOME/scripts/gen_secrets.sh -n oo-prod -c oo-helm-charts-1.x.x+26.x.x/oo-helm-charts/charts/oo-1.x.x+26.x.x.tgz

  2. The Vault secret utility prompts you for the following passwords. 

    Vault Secrets

    Key

    Required?

    Description
    idm_admin_admin_password

    Yes

    		 Provide the password of the oo-integration-admin user. This user was created as part of the preparation step Create OO integration admin user in the Service Management IdM.
    OO_CENTRAL_DB_PASS

    Yes

    The password of the OO Central database user which was created as part of the preparation step Prepare external databases for OO.
    OO_AUTOPASS_DB_PASS Yes The password of the AutoPass database user which was created as part of the preparation step Prepare external databases for OO.
    OO_IDM_DB_PASS No

    Ignore this request, as it belongs to a beta feature of OO which isn't yet available. 

    Press ENTER when prompted for this data. Doing so will generate a random string that isn't used by OO.
    OO_CONTROLLER_DB_PASS Yes The password of the OO Controller database user which was created as part of the preparation step Prepare external databases for OO.
    ITOM_DB_PASSWD_KEY

    No

    Ignore this request, as it belongs to a beta feature of OO which isn't yet available. 

    Press ENTER when prompted for this data. Doing so will generate a random string that isn't used by OO.
    idm_transport_admin_password

    Yes

    		 Provide the password of the suite IDM transport user. The password was obtained as part of the preparation step Get connection details for connecting to the Service Management IdM.
    OO_UI_DB_PASS

    Yes

    		 The password of the OO Session Manager database user which was created as part of the preparation step Prepare external databases for OO.
    OO_SCHEDULER_DB_PASS

    Yes

    		 The password of the OO Scheduler database user which was created as part of the preparation step Prepare external databases for OO.
